activities.loc: Br 9 - Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference on March 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
NG plea entered.

9:59 AM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Demarion B Tucker appeared in court, Attorney Robert William Keller appeared in court for Demarion B Tucker. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Status conference scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 3, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:40 PM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Demarion B Tucker appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Addison R Kuhn appeared by video for Demarion B Tucker. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
BTC: Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. Finding of good cause to waive time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 3, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Initial appearance on January 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
